SEARCH
Package librarySE.core

Class Book

java.lang.Object
librarySE.core.AbstractLibraryItem
librarySE.core.Book
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Borrowable, LibraryItem, Searchable
public class Book extends AbstractLibraryItem
Represents a Book item in the library system.

A Book is uniquely identified by its ISBN and contains metadata such as title, author, and price. The class extends AbstractLibraryItem, inheriting full copy-tracking functionality including borrowing and returning.

Main Characteristics

  • Each book has a unique ISBN.
  • Supports multiple physical copies of the same title.
  • Provides synchronized borrow/return operations for thread safety.
  • Price can be supplied or loaded from configuration defaults.

Copy Management

  • Total copies = number of physical units owned by the library.
  • Available copies = number of units currently not borrowed.
  • A book is available when availableCopies â‰¥ 1.

Concurrency Notes

All mutations to copy-related state are synchronized in the parent class to guarantee safe concurrent access in multi-threaded contexts.

Author:
eman

  • Constructor Details

    • Book

      public Book(String isbn, String title, String author, BigDecimal price)
      Creates a Book with exactly one copy.
      Parameters:
      isbn - unique ISBN identifier, must not be blank
      title - the book title, must not be blank
      author - the author name, must not be blank
      price - the price; if null or invalid, a configured default is loaded

    • Book

      public Book(String isbn, String title, String author, BigDecimal price, int totalCopies)
      Creates a Book with a specified number of total copies.
      Parameters:
      isbn - unique ISBN identifier, must not be blank
      title - the book title, must not be blank
      author - the author name, must not be blank
      price - the price; if null or invalid, a configured default is loaded
      totalCopies - number of physical copies; must be ≥ 1

      public boolean matchesKeyword(String keyword)

      Matching fields include:

      • title
      • author
      • ISBN

      Parameters:
      keyword - search keyword; must not be blank
      Returns:
      true if the keyword appears in any searchable field
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if keyword is empty
